commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: The School Idol Festival, huh?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I never thought I'd find myself involved in it like this.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Yes, come in.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Excuse me.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Uehara? What is the matter? Is there something else you wish to say?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah. Shioriko... I mean, Mifune, I forgot to congratulate you.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Congratulate me? For what?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I know it's a little late, but I wanted to congratulate you for putting together a successful school tour. I heard we received a huge number of applicants to enroll.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What? Ah, yes. I am grateful for all of the assistance you provided.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: And, um, just going back to what we were discussing. The School Idol Festival really is a great event, you know? It's known as a festival especially for school idols, and...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I know.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: What?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: The School Idol Festival is precisely the result of constantly clinging to something one lacks any aptitude for.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: What do you mean?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That event is what made my sister, who was broken by being a school idol... No, that doesn't matter at all.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: It doesn't matter? It sounds like it matters a lot to you...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It really doesn't matter. I also do not care about whether or not the School Idol Festival is a great event.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: You don't look like you don't care.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It matters not how I appear to you. Could you please leave me alone?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I can't.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Why not? You are only doing me an unwelcome favor otherwise.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Unwelcome favor or not, you always look so pained when we bring up the School Idol Festival. I can't just ignore that.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Do you really have the leisure to meddle with me? Isn't there something you should be doing right now with your other club members?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You must gather a thousand volunteers by the deadline. This condition absolutely must be met if you wish to hold the School Idol Festival at our school.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: The School Idol Festival itself will cease to exist if you are short by even one person. Do you understand?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Of course I do.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You clearly do not. In my experience, running an event with individual volunteers is based on an extremely uncertain level of trust in them.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Just because you have resolved to gather one thousand volunteers does not necessarily mean they will appear out of thin air. I believe it is near impossible.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I understand where you're coming from... But I disagree. We'll gather those volunteers to show you that it's possible.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: The School Idol Festival is our dream... It's the dream of all of Nijigasaki High School. We will make it a reality.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That does not include me. I do not have dreams of that sort at all.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I see... But you like school idols, don't you?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I would not say that exactly.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: That's a lie.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Why would I lie about such a thing?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Because you wouldn't have been so serious at practice if you hated school idols.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That was the deal I agreed to. Why would I do so otherwise?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Then I'll leave it at that for now.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: My stance will continue to remain the same.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Shio... I mean, Mifune, I know that you're a kind person, regardless of your stance.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Why would you suddenly say something like that? I do not understand.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Well, you were the one who told us we'd need a thousand people to hold our event, right? You were kind enough to tell us that so we would succeed, right?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: No, that was not my intention!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Well, I'll just leave it at that. Anyway, look forward to the event! We'll make sure we gather a thousand people!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Goodness me... You are far more stubborn than you appear.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: *Chuckle* You're the same as well, aren't you, Shio... I mean, Mifune?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Allow me to say one thing. I do not care what people call me.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I have been called many things such as Shioko, Shio-ti, the demon student council president, and even cold-blooded. As such, you can call me whatever you wish.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I-I'm sorry. Did that bother you?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Indeed, it did. It is difficult to focus on the conversation at hand, so please just call me whatever you wish.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Hehe, then that's what I'll do! See ya, Shioriko!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: *Sigh*

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Why are people who are engrossed in school idols all like that? I do not understand it at all.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: But the thing I have trouble understanding the most, is myself.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I shouldn't want that event to go forward. If I'm to be forced to bring it back, then I want to be the one to end it.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: But then, why did I give them such a condition for approval?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What is it that I am trying to accomplish, exactly?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: The School Idol Festival...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It's what my sister left...
